title: How I'd Invest $2 Million at Age 65 for a Worry-Free Retirement
subtitle: A strategic approach to maximize wealth and income in retirement.
content:
How I'd Invest $2 Million at Age 65 for a Worry-Free Retirement

I'm Tyler, I'm a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Now I make financial content for free so you don't have to pay for it.

1. Invest in VOO

Start by putting $1.8 million into VOO, Vanguard's S&P 500 fund. This is a low-cost, diversified investment across many businesses, and I would expect a 7% real return over time.

2. Stability with SPAXX

The remaining $200,000 would go into Fidelity's money market fund, SPAXX. T-bills provide stability and liquidity—a crucial 'shock absorber' needed at age 65.

3. Withdrawal Strategy

I would begin by withdrawing 4% a year from the VOO, which equates to about $72,000 a year. However, I’d sell 0.33% monthly instead of all at once annually, since markets tend to be higher at the end of the year than at the beginning.

4. Combine Income Sources

From the money market, I'd expect to yield about $8,000 a year. Coupled with another $25,000 a year from the VOO dividends and $30,000 from Social Security—which is the national average for higher earners—my total annual income would come to about $135,000.

5. Lifestyle Benefits

That's more than enough for daily walks in the woods, coffee on the porch, and even the occasional spending spree at Filson.

Conclusion

If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link in my bio. Each week, I'll send you over another money playbook that actually works.
